data.text: Will seek out the wisdom of all the ancients,
He will keep the sayings of the renowned men:
He will seek out the secrets of grave sentences,
He shall serve among great men,
He will give his heart to resort early to the Lord that made him,
When the great Lord will,
He shall direct his counsel and knowledge,
He shall show forth that which he hath learned,
Many shall commend his understanding;
Nations shall show forth his wisdom,
If he die, he shall leave a greater name than a thousand:
Yet have I more to say, which I have thought upon;
Hearken unto me, ye holy children,
And give ye a sweet savor as frankincense,
Magnify his name,
All the works of the Lord are exceeding good,
For at time convenient they shall all be sought out:
At his commandment is done whatsoever pleaseth him;
The works of all flesh are before him,
He seeth from everlasting to everlasting;
A man need not to say, What is this? wherefore is that?
His blessing covered the dry land as a river,
As he hath turned the waters into saltness:
As his ways are plain unto the holy;
For the good are good things created from the beginning:
The principal things for the whole use of manâ€™s life
All these things are for good to the godly:
There be spirits that are created for vengeance,
Fire, and hail, and famine, and death,
Teeth of wild beasts, and scorpions, serpents,
Shall rejoice in his commandment,
Therefore from the beginning I was resolved,
All the works of the Lord are good:
So that a man cannot say, This is worse than that:
And therefore praise ye the Lord with the whole heart and mouth,
